title: Kraken/ko

| A kraken:* can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim").
* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                       |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [monst.c#line2639](/wiki/Monst.c#line2639 "Monst.c")                                  |

The **kraken**, ;, is the most difficult [sea monster](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") in [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack"). Like the lesser [giant eel](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel") and [electric eel](/wiki/Electric_eel "Electric eel"), it possesses the [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") [drowning attack](/wiki/Drowning_attack "Drowning attack").

## 전략

크라켄은 가끔씩 역[학살](/wiki/Genocide/ko "Genocide/ko")의 대상이 되기도 합니다, [오르커스](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus")와 [Rider](/wiki/Rider "Rider")의 값보다 여섯번째로 높은 [경험치](/wiki/Experience_point "Experience point")를 가집니다; only the other [demon princes](/wiki/Demon_prince "Demon prince") offer more experience. 다른 바다 괴물들처럼, 그들은 여전히 상당한 피해를 주는 공격을 가지고 있지만, 물 밖에서는 위험하지는 않습니다.

## Encyclopedia entry

Out from the water a long sinous tentacle  
had crawled; it was pale-green and luminous  
and wet. Its fingered end had a hold of Frodo's  
foot, and was dragging him into the water.  
Sam on his knees was now slashing at it with  
a knife. The arm let go of Frodo, and Sam  
pulled him away, crying out for help.  
Twenty other arms came rippling out. The  
dark water boiled, and there was a hideous stench.

\[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R Tolken ]

## 언넷핵

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") reassigns the *Fellowship of the Ring* excerpt to the [Watcher in the Water](/wiki/Watcher_in_the_Water#UnNetHack "Watcher in the Water"), a unique monster inspired directly by that passage, and gives the kraken a new encyclopedia entry:

"Below the thunders of the upper deep;  
Far, far beneath in the abysmal sea,  
His ancient, dreamless, uninvaded sleep  
The Kraken sleepeth: faintest sunlights flee  
About his shadowy sides: above him swell  
Huge sponges of millennial growth and height;  
And far away into the sickly light,  
From many a wondrous grot and secret cell  
Unnumber'd and enormous polypi  
Winnow with giant arms the slumbering green.  
There hath he lain for ages and will lie  
Battening upon huge seaworms in his sleep,  
Until the latter fire shall heat the deep;  
Then once by man and angels to be seen,  
In roaring he shall rise and on the surface die."

\[ The Kraken, by Alfred, Lord Tennyson ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d6/Nh360-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-360}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Kraken/ko

From NetHackWiki
< Kraken
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Kraken
Template:Monsym/kraken/ko kraken/ko (No tile)
Difficulty 22
Attacks Claw 2d4, Claw 2d4, drowning 2d6, bite 5d4
Template:Monsym/kraken/ko kraken/ko (No tile)
Difficulty 22
Attacks

Claw 2d4, Claw 2d4, drowning 2d6, bite 5d4

Base level 20
Base experience 1574
Speed 3
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1800
Nutritional value 1000
Size Huge
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A kraken:

  • can swim.
  • can survive underwater.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line2639

The kraken, ;, is the most difficult sea monster in NetHack. Like the lesser giant eel and electric eel, it possesses the instadeath drowning attack.

전략

크라켄은 가끔씩 역학살의 대상이 되기도 합니다, 오르커스와 Rider의 값보다 여섯번째로 높은 경험치를 가집니다; only the other demon princes offer more experience. 다른 바다 괴물들처럼, 그들은 여전히 상당한 피해를 주는 공격을 가지고 있지만, 물 밖에서는 위험하지는 않습니다.

Encyclopedia entry

Out from the water a long sinous tentacle
had crawled; it was pale-green and luminous
and wet. Its fingered end had a hold of Frodo's
foot, and was dragging him into the water.
Sam on his knees was now slashing at it with
a knife. The arm let go of Frodo, and Sam
pulled him away, crying out for help.
Twenty other arms came rippling out. The
dark water boiled, and there was a hideous stench.

[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R Tolken ]

언넷핵

UnNetHack reassigns the Fellowship of the Ring excerpt to the Watcher in the Water, a unique monster inspired directly by that passage, and gives the kraken a new encyclopedia entry:

"Below the thunders of the upper deep;
Far, far beneath in the abysmal sea,
His ancient, dreamless, uninvaded sleep
The Kraken sleepeth: faintest sunlights flee
About his shadowy sides: above him swell
Huge sponges of millennial growth and height;
And far away into the sickly light,
From many a wondrous grot and secret cell
Unnumber'd and enormous polypi
Winnow with giant arms the slumbering green.
There hath he lain for ages and will lie
Battening upon huge seaworms in his sleep,
Until the latter fire shall heat the deep;
Then once by man and angels to be seen,
In roaring he shall rise and on the surface die."

[ The Kraken, by Alfred, Lord Tennyson ]


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.0. Information on this page may be out of date.

The '''kraken''', {{monsym|kraken}}, is the most difficult [[sea monster]] in [[NetHack]]. Like the lesser [[giant eel]] and [[electric eel]], it possesses the [[instadeath]] [[drowning attack]].

==전략==
크라켄은 가끔씩 역[[genocide/ko|학살]]의 대상이 되기도 합니다, [[Orcus|오르커스]]와 [[Rider]]의 값보다 여섯번째로 높은 [[experience point|경험치]]를 가집니다; only the other [[demon prince]]s offer more experience. 다른 바다 괴물들처럼, 그들은 여전히 상당한 피해를 주는 공격을 가지고 있지만, 물 밖에서는 위험하지는 않습니다.

foot, and was dragging him into the water.

|[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R Tolken ]

==언넷핵==
[[UnNetHack]] reassigns the ''Fellowship of the Ring'' excerpt to the [[Watcher in the Water#UnNetHack|Watcher in the Water]], a unique monster inspired directly by that passage, and gives the kraken a new encyclopedia entry:
